stimulusHtml: A rover attached by a cord to a parachute falls downward at constant speed near the surface of Mars. F1→ is the gravitational force exerted on the rover by Mars and F2→ is the tension force exerted on the rover by the cord. Are these two forces a Newton’s third law pair? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because they are equal in magnitude and opposite in direction.
Yes, because they are both internal to the rover-parachute-Mars system.
No, because they are not equal in magnitude and opposite in direction.
No, because the forces are not an interaction between the same two objects.
